com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core
Class UnitProvider

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.ChangeProvider
      com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.UnitProvider

public abstract class UnitProvider
extends ChangeProvider

Provide information about elements that may be deployed including adapting an arbitrary element to a DeployModelObject.

Any element is potentially deployable. Clients must describe to the SOA Topology Modeler framework which elements may be deployed using the com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.unitLifecycle/unitProvider extension point. That extension point requires clients to supply a subclass of this object. The client implementation will only be invoked when an element matching the expression defined by the client's extension is encountered.

Please refer to the extension point documentation for com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.unitLifecycle/unitProvider for more information.

Since:
1.0

Method Detail

resolveStubs

public abstract TopologyUnitStub[] resolveStubs(java.lang.Object anInputObject)
Given an input object (from a view or otherwise indicated by the user), quickly determine what underlying domain model elements the input object may correspond to. Avoid any heavy operations or more document loading than is absolutely necessary.

Parameters:
anInputObject - An element that matches the input enablement specified by the extension corresponding to this provider.
Returns:
An array of stub elements that can be used to represent the potential underlying domain model elements.

resolveUnit

public abstract java.lang.Object[] resolveUnit(TopologyUnitStub aStub,
                                               boolean toResolveLazily,
                                               IProgressMonitor aMonitor)
Parameters:
aStub - The stub that was selected by the user or the framework for more detailed resolution.
toResolveLazily - True indicates that the underlying EMF model should initially restrict the population of its fields to the bare minimum; fields should be resolved and populated as the client of this provider requests them. False indicates that the EMF object should be fully resolved (and thus all of its fields completely populated) when returned.
aMonitor - Announce the underlying events to the monitor to provide user-feedback in long running operations. Implementations should be prepared to handle null (even if only converting the null value to a NullPointerException.
Returns:
An array of DeployModelObjects representing the underlying domain model corresponding to the given stub.

resolveLinks

public abstract boolean resolveLinks(java.util.List aDeployModelObjects,
                                     IProgressMonitor aMonitor)
Parameters:
aDeployModelObjects - The list of deploy model objects that need to be used as source to resolve the links for.
aMonitor - Announce the underlying events to the monitor to provide user-feedback in long running operations. Implementations should be prepared to handle null (even if only converting the null value to a NullPointerException.
Returns:
A boolean value as true, if any links were added or updated.

createImportChange

public Change[] createImportChange(Topology topology,
                                   TopologyUnitStub stub,
                                   IProgressMonitor monitor)
Description copied from class: ChangeProvider
Create a change object to carry out modifications to the set of Units based on the current state of the reflected artifacts.

Overrides:
createImportChange in class ChangeProvider
stub - The affected stub, reflected by the unit provider, and chosen by the user to add to the model.
Returns:
A change object, which may be undoable, to carry out changes necessary in order to synchronize the state of the model with the state of the external artifacts.
